title: Stored XSS in IE11 on hackerone.com via custom fields

profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

Regards,
@antenna

additional_data.new_title: Stored XSS in IE11 on hackerone.com via custom fields

activities.message:
Hello @tester2020,

Thank you for your submission! We have submitted your report to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Regards,
@antenna
Any updates?
No updates yet, but I'll triage this. We're planning on removing IE11 access to the site, but it may take some time to communicate with users this plan.
Hey @tester2020 my team has informed me they've pushed a fix for the XSS, can you retest for us?

Hi @Bencode, This issue has been fixed: {F1323365} As you can see on the above photo : Result after reload the page again: 1-No error in the console log. 2- we can see both values in (from) & (to) are sanitized and escaping malicious script to prevent XSS attacks : >`updated custom field "">k" from "> to ">f .` 3-Also you have sanitized the attacker value in the '(Custom data - hacker facing) field' ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ but let's ==bypass that fix== with a new payload here `"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)> ` _Steps:_ 1-The attacker report a bug to the affected program and put this payload `"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)> ` in Additional information field in the report and then submit the report. {F1323404} ---- 2-The program admin open the attacker report and doing this actions [edit or modify or change and save it] to the value of the attacker in report(Custom data - hacker facing) field. ---- 3-Stored xss happen again so both values in (from) & (to) are not sanitized from malicious code: {F1323403} --- 4-A stored xss issue fire in IE11 browser when the admin of the program open the attacker report : {F1323407}
Thanks for verifying
Revert report state to triaged from retesting

Hey @bencode,

i just want to add that's issue can affect admins and any users who open the attacker report with out any interference from them.

affect any one who participants in the attacker report and when the report became public this will affect all hackerone users without any interference from them also even if the report is still private the attacker can add any collaborators to his malicious report.


Payload:
`Stored xss issue here without any interference from program Admins"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)> `

██████████

Please watch the above video for more explanation.
[ Any updates ](#activity-11995733)

Hey @bencode,

any updates for my [last comment](#activity-11995733) , this can change the report Severity to :

Attack Complexity : Low

Privileges Required : None

User Interaction : None

would you mind to take a look to the report severity again?


Thanks

Hi @tester2020 - we've deployed a code change that should mitigate the vulnerability. Can you confirm? Thanks! RE severity: we'll assess the severity before we determine the reward and will take your suggestion into account.

Hi @jobert Thanks for reply, i have tested this issue and i found the 3 payloads below is now fixed : 1-`">` 2-`"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)>` 3-`Stored xss issue here without any interference from program Admins"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)>` --------------------------- ##but ==i still can bypass your fix== by using this payloads below by using HTML Entities Encoder: 1-`"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)>` {F1342904} ============================== 2-`Stored xss issue here without any interference from program Admins"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)>` {F1342903} --------------- Note as we can saw in the comment [i can attack users without any interference from them](#activity-11995733) but her with a new bypass payload: A-`Stored xss issue here without any interference from program Admins"><img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)>` --------------------- The payload below is not working right now but i think it's a bypass to your next fix: `"&gt;&lt;img src=x onerror=alert(document.domain)&gt;` ---------------- Thanks @tester2020
Hi @tester2020 - thanks, we'll nuke the library into orbit to fix the issue instead! Give us a few days to remove it entirely.
Revert report state to triaged from retesting
Hi @tester2020 - alright, we refactored this! Mind retesting this, hopefully, one last time? Thanks!

Hi @jobert,

I've tested this issue for 3 hours in hopes of finding a way to bypass your fix and found that all payloads were fixed so
I confirm this issue has been fixed, it's a perfect solution.

Well done!
Amazing, thanks for confirming the fix, we really appreciate your diligence!

Hi @tester2020 - thanks again for bringing this to our attention, this was a great find! Given the very limited user base that was still accessing the site using Internet Explorer 11, we believe that this was a medium severity vulnerability. We did take your suggestion into consideration, but because of the browser requirement and required user interaction (a program member has to upload the XSS payload or expose a hacker facing custom field), we're not changing the suggested severity. We've also removed support for Internet Explorer 11. Because of that, we're awarding you with a $2,500 bounty. We look forward to receiving more reports from you in the future, can't wait to see what you'll come up with next!

Hi @jobert,

Thanks for bounty also would you mind to delete all the videos in this report because it contains reports for other program "title of reports and name of private programs"

attached ids:

@tester2020 Thanks for flagging, I've removed them.

summaries.content: Hi @security, _Steps:_ 1-The affected program is enabled with a Hacker Facing Custom Fields feature: https://hackerone.com/:handle/custom_fields `Custom Fields` >> `Hacker Facing Custom Fields` >>`new field with a title name (hello)` >> `Select type : text` >> `Visibility; Hacker facing - this field will appear on the report for the hacker to complete` 2-Then a malicious user report a bug to that program and put this payload `">` to Additional information field in the report and then submit the report. 3-when the program admin open the attacker report and doing this actions [edit or modify or change and save it] to the value of the attacker in report(Custom data - hacker facing) field as a result a stored xss issue happen. {F1277066} Poc: https://hackerone.com/reports/1173040#activity-11548302 ----- i think this issue happen when rendering the report data via : ==updated custom field (from) `the attacker value` (to) `a new value` both values in (from) & (to) are not sanitized from malicious code so the attacker malicious payload executed there.== {F1277062} ==so even if the program admin have changed the attacker payload in the report (Custom data - hacker facing) field in order to prevent the attacker code from execute, the attacker payload will be saved in the report data for ever in `(from) value` and the attack going to work permanently.== ---------------------------------------------------
